intro: Cryptolepis sanguinolenta, commonly known as the red-rooted cryptolepis, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, dry fruits. Its roots are reddish in color and contain various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or disturbed areas.
